items.title: Foo Fighters Set for One-Off Tasmania Return With Launceston StadiumยGig
items.summary: The Launceston date is Foo Fightersโ only Australian show scheduled for 2026 so far.
items.body: Foo Fighters are set to return to Tasmania this weekend for a one-off sold-out stadium show in Launceston, marking the bandโs first performance in the Apple Isle in more than a decade and their first-ever concert in the northern Tasmanian city. The American rock group will play UTAS Stadium on Saturday, Jan. 24, with Frontier Touring and the band sharing a detailed โKnow Before You Goโ guide on Thursday (Jan. 22) outlining key information for ticketholders ahead of the sold-out event. โTASMANIA!!! KNOW BEFORE YOU GO,โ the band wrote while resharing the promoterโs post on social media. โSEE YOU SOONโฆโ The Launceston date is Foo Fightersโ only Australian show scheduled for 2026 so far and comes after tickets sold out rapidly during the general on-sale, with fans travelling from across the country to secure entry. No additional dates have been announced. The concert will be all-ages, with all attendees requiring a valid ticket regardless of age. Entry will be digital-only, with tickets accessible via mobile devices. Doors at UTAS Stadium are set to open at 5 p.m., with the show scheduled to begin at 6:20 p.m. Foo Fighters will be joined on the night by special guests Full Flower Moonโฆ

items.title: Hilltop Hoods Edge Past Billie Eilish in triple j Hottest 100ยHistory
items.summary: Hilltop Hoods have been fixtures of the Hottest 100 since the early 2000s.
items.body: Australian hip-hop heavyweights Hilltop Hoods have reclaimed a long-held triple j Hottest 100 record from Billie Eilish . As results rolled in throughout the annual broadcast on Saturday (Jan. 25), the Adelaide hip-hop trioโs latest entries pushed them ahead of Eilish on the tally, marking another milestone in the groupโs enduring relationship with Australiaโs most influential listener-voted chart. Hilltop Hoods have been fixtures of the Hottest 100 since the early 2000s, with songs spanning multiple eras of their career consistently finding favour with triple j voters. Their sustained presence across decades places them among a small group of Australian acts to repeatedly chart in the countdown, reflecting both their crossover appeal and deep-rooted connection to local audiences. Eilish, by contrast, has built her Hottest 100 footprint in a far shorter time frame, racking up entries since her breakout years and becoming one of the most successful international artists in the pollโs recent history. Her run has been emblematic of triple jโs increasingly global scope, particularly as streaming-driven pop and alternative releases have come to dominate recent countdowns. The moment alโฆ

items.title: BTS Arirang World Tour DreamยSetlist
items.summary: While we're expecting loads of new tracks from the group's upcoming ARIRANG album, these are the super hits we're hoping to hear when the guys hit stadiums around the globe.
items.body: BTS ‘ forthcoming Arirang World Tour is arriving as a truly historic live trek for the pop royalty that is the Bangtan Boys โ and it requires a monumental setlist to accompany it. Originally announced with 79 shows across 34 regions in five continents, the tour has already grown in its initial size with two additional U.S. dates added in both Tampa, Florida, and Stanford, California, as the first tickets went on sale this week. The group will things kick off in Goyang, South Korea, on April 9, 2026, and continue throughout 2027 with additional cities said to soon be announced in Japan, the Middle East and beyond. Related BTS Announces Massive Global Tour: Here Are the Dates The Arirang World Tour marks BTS’ first live concert series since the Permission to Dance on Stage tour that held mini-residencies in Seoul, Los Angeles and Las Vegas in 2021 and 2022 with 22 songs in the main setlist and three songs in the encore. During the period where members handled their individual mandatory military services, BTS members Suga , J-Hope and Jin managed to embark on their own solo tours. Suga embarked on his D-Day Tour across North America and Asia in 2023 before his militaโฆ

items.title: Every Album Certified Double Diamond by the RIAA: FullยList
items.summary: To think, the RIAA didn't have a sales award higher than gold until 1976.
items.body: UPDATE (Jan. 23): The Eagles got a double dose of good news on Jan. 22, when the Recording Industry Association of America re-certified their 1976 compilation Eagles/Their Greatest Hits 1971-1975 , at the 40 million level and their subsequent studio album Hotel California at the 28 million level. The greatest-hits album was already No. 1 on our list of albums that have been certified Double Diamond or better by the RIAA. The latest upgrade allowed Hotel California to move up from No. 4 to No. 3 on the list. Related Eagles’ ‘Greatest Hits’ Is First Album to Be Certified Quadruple Diamond by RIAA PREVIOUSLY (Dec. 5. 2025): Metallica celebrated a major career milestone in May, when their 1991 album Metallica was certified Double Diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). It was just the 14th album to reach that plateau , which signifies shipments of 20 million albums (or streaming equivalent units) in the U.S. Double Diamond albums were unthinkable when the RIAA launched its gold awards program in 1958. Only one album was certified gold that year (signifying $1 million in manufacturerโs dollar volume; the criteria later changed) โ the sounโฆ

items.title: Pharrell Williams Sued by Neptunes Partner Chad Hugo Amid Split: โFraudulent Conductโ
items.summary: The former musical duo, which produced some of the biggest hits of the 2000s, is headed to court over accusations of unpaid royalties and "self-dealing."
items.body: Pharrell Williams is facing a lawsuit from his former Neptunes partner Chad Hugo , who claims his longtime friend has cut him out of their company and owes him as much as $1 million from an N.E.R.D. album. Before Pharrell became a solo superstar, he and Hugo formed a prolific songwriting duo for years, producing massive hits like Nellyโs โHot in Herre,โ Snoop Doggโs โDrop It Like Itโs Hot,โ Gwen Stefaniโs โHollaback Girlโ and Justin Timberlakeโs โRock Your Body.โ They also formed two-thirds of N.E.R.D., a hip-hop/rock band that enjoyed its own run of hit albums in the 2000s and 2010s. But in a strongly-worded lawsuit filed Friday (Jan. 23), Hugo accuses Williams โ his friend since their Virginia childhoods โ of committing a wide range of legal wrongdoing against his former partner. โWilliams engaged in self-dealing, concealed material information, and โฆ diverted revenues owed to plaintiff,โ writes Hugoโs attorney, Brent J. Lehman of the law firm Munck Wilson Mandala. โSuch willful, fraudulent, and malicious conduct warrants the imposition of punitive damages.โ Fridayโs lawsuit, obtained and first reported by Billboard , isnโt the first legal battle between the two collaborators. Bโฆ

items.title: Phil Collins Reveals Heโs Under 24-Hour Care, But Feeling โTotally Mobile & Healthyโ inยUpdate
items.summary: "Everything that could go wrong with me, did go wrong with me," the musician shared.
items.body: Phil Collins has given fans another health update as he continues to face a number of challenges, explaining that his issues are “an ongoing thing” in an interview with BBC’s Eras . In the conversation dropping Jan. 26, the drummer was candid about the level of treatment he requires on a daily basis to keep him going after a 2007 spinal injury left him with myriad health challenges. “I have a 24-hour live-in nurse to make sure I take my medication, as I should do,” Collins said. Related Phil Collins Says He Isn’t ‘Hungry’ to Make Music Anymore as He’s Been ‘Very Sick’ Phil Collins Is in Hospital for Surgery, Not in Hospice, Rep Confirms Robert Irwin Breaks Down in Tears Dancing to Phil Collins ‘Tarzan’ Ballad on ‘DWTS’ Dedication Night Routine in Honor of Mom “I’ve had challenges with my knee,” he continued. “Everything that could go wrong with me, did go wrong with me … I can walk, albeit with assistance — crutches or whatever.” The update comes about six months after Collins’ rep confirmed that he was in the hospital for an operโฆ

items.title: Eminem Performs Medley of Career-Spanning Hits at Rare Private Concert inยDetroit
items.summary: Rocket Mortgage employees were treated to a surprise show from Slim Shady at Little Caesars Arena.
items.body: Eminem crashed Rocket Mortgage’s annual all-team meeting at Detroit’s Little Caesars Arena on Thursday night (Jan. 22), which saw Slim Shady perform a medley of hits as part of his surprise appearance. The Detroit legend sent the thousands of workers into a frenzy when he popped out onstage in a hoodie jacket, gray jeans and white Nike sneakers. Related Detroit Icons Eminem & Jack White Share Stage for First Time at Epic Thanksgiving Day Halftime Show Eminem & Rihanna Earn ‘Monster’ Feat as 11-Year-Old Music Video Joins YouTube’s Billion Views Club Eminem Teams With NBA & Ghostwrite for Limited-Edition ‘Game Face’ Detroit Pistons Capsule Collection Em ran through a nine-track set spanning his Hall of Fame career, which included rare live performances of “Lose Yourself,” “Square Dance,” “3 AM,” “The Real Slim Shady,” “Kill You,” “Stan,” “My Name Is,” “Without Me” and “Houdini.” Rocket Mortgage has been known to go the extra mile for its employees’ entertainment, as Lil Wayne was the special guest perfoโฆ

items.title: Sean Paul Scores First RIAA Diamond Certification With This SmashยCollaboration
items.summary: The Jamaican dancehall superstar keeps racking up the accolades.
items.body: Sean Paul ‘s list of achievements just got longer. “Cheap Thrills,” his smash 2016 collaboration with Sia , was certified 11 times platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America on Thursday, marking more than 11 million units — his first song to achieve the diamond-plus feat. The voice behind iconic dancehall crossover hits like “Temperature,” “Get Busy” and “Gimme the Light,” Sean Paul exploded onto the Billboard charts in 2000, kicking off more than two decades of cross-genre success. 2002’s Dutty Rock earned him the Grammy for best reggae album and became his first of two top 10 projects on the Billboard 200 . Over on the Billboard Hot 100 , Paul has notched four No. 1 singles from 10 top 10 hits, including the four-week chart-topper “Cheap Thrills.” Related 20 Questions With Sean Paul: Dancehall Legend Discusses Greatest Tour, Clashing & Crossover Collaborations ‘Jamaica Strong’ Hurricane Melissa Relief Benefit Concert Heats Up New York City: 5 Best Moments November Reggae/Dancehall Fresh Picks of the Month: Vybz Kartel, Shatta Wale, Kes, Popcaan & More Sโฆ

items.title: Who Will Head to Super Bowl LX? Hereโs How to Watch the Rams vs. Seahawks in NFC Championship 2026 Game Online forยFree
items.summary: Kickoff for the game begins at 6:30 p.m. ET/3:30 p.m. PT.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. With football fans on the edge of their seats, it’s finally time to see who will make it to Super Bowl LX. The NFC Championship 2026 is finally here, offering two teams a chance at a spot in this year’s Super Bowl . On Saturday, Jan. 25, the Seattle Seahawks will host the Los Angeles Rams at Lumen Field in Seattle, Washington, battling it out on the turf for a shot at glory. Kickoff begins at 6:30 p.m. ET/3:30 p.m. PT. Last weekend, the Seahawks beat the 49ers 41-6, while the Rams also came off an overtime win against the Bears 20-17 with “the Thiccer Kicker” Harrison Mevis clutching a 42-yard field goal that sealed the team’s win. Speaking of the Super Bowl, Puerto Rican musician Bad Bunny is set to perform at the highly-anticipated halftime show. The Seattle Seahawks are slight 2.5-point favorites over the Los Angeles Rams in the 2026 NFC Championship game, according to oddsmakers. Only time will tell who will take hoโฆ

items.title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station
items.summary: NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyโs Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news cโฆ
items.body: NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 crew, from left to right, is NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: SpaceX NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyโs Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news conference that will stream on the agencyโs YouTube channel. Next, the crew of NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 mission will participate in a virtual news conference from NASA Johnson crew quarters at 1 p.m., also on the agencyโs YouTube channel. Individual streams for each of the events will be available on that page. This is the final media opportunity with Crew-12 before they travel to NASAโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida for launch. Crew-12 will carry NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway , ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev to the orbiting laboratory. The crew will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft on the companyโs Faโฆ

items.title: NASA Awards Global Modeling, Assimilation Support Contract
items.summary: NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyโs Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-deliveryโฆ
items.body: Credit: NASA NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyโs Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum ordering value of approximately $84 million with a five-year period of performance beginning March 15, 2026. Under this contract, the contractor will be responsible for supporting and maintaining NASA Goddardโs Global Modeling and Assimilation Officeโs Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) model and data assimilation system. Tasks include supporting the development and validation of individual model components within GEOS and the development and integration of external components like sea and land-ice models within the modeling and assimilation system. For information about NASA and other agency programs, visit: https://www.nasa.gov -end- Tiernan Doyle Headquarters, Washington 202-358-1600 tiernan.doyle@nasa.gov Rob Garner Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, Md. 301-286-5687 rob.garner@nasa.gov Share Details Last Updated Jan 2โฆ

items.title: NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission
items.summary: NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionโs journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAโs Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep spโฆ
items.body: 4 Min Read NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission A visual representation of NASA’s Artemis I mission. Credits: NASA NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionโs journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAโs Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep space. The agencyโs second mission in the Artemis campaign is a key step in NASAโs path toward establishing a long-term presence at the Moon and confirming the systems needed to support future lunar surface exploration and paving the way for the first crewed mission to Mars. While NASAโs Near Space Network and Deep Space Network , coordinated by the agencyโs SCaN (Space Communication and Navigation) program , will provide primary communications and tracking services to support Orionโs launch, journey around the Moon, and return to Earth, participants selected from a request for proposals published in August 2025, comprised of established commercial service providers, members of academia, and individual amateur radio enthusiasts will use their respective โฆ

items.title: I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert
items.summary: Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: During NASAโs Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAโs Johnson Sโฆ
items.body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager, sits in the OCSS Lab at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Credits: NASA/Rad Sinyak Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: 0:00 / 0:00 Your browser does not support the audio element. During NASAโs Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAโs Johnson Space Center in Houston, Dustin Gohmert leads the team responsible for these suits, known as the Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS). โWe work with the crew to say, โHereโs this design concept we have. How does this really work in the spaceflight environment?โโ Gohmert said. โAs we evolve the design, we take the crewโs input and we adapt the suit over time to take into account not only the desire we have for safety, but the real-world impacts that it has.โ The suits will protect astronauts on launch day, throughout high-risk parts of missions near the Moon, during the high-speed return to Earth, and in emergency situations if such events arโฆ

items.title: Red, Green Light Show
items.summary: A green and red aurora streams across Earthโs horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the โฆ
items.body: NASA/Chris Williams A green and red aurora streams across Earthโs horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the image was captured. Also known as the northern lights ( aurora borealis ) or southern lights ( aurora australis ), auroras are colorful, dynamic, and often visually delicate displays of an intricate dance of particles and magnetism between the Sun and Earth called space weather. When energetic particles from space collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, they can cause the colorful glow that we call auroras. Image credit: NASA/Chris Williams

items.title: NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthโs Water
items.summary: A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonโs record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthโs history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a signifโฆ
items.body: 4 min read NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthโs Water A close-up view of a portion of a โrelatively freshโ crater, looking southeast, as photographed during the third Apollo 15 lunar surface moonwalk. Credit: NASA A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonโs record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthโs history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a significant source of Earthโs water as they bombarded our planet early in the solar systemโs development. In a paper published Tuesday in the Proceedings to the National Academy of Sciences, researchers led by Tony Gargano, a postdoctoral fellow at NASAโs Johnson Space Center and the Lunar and Planetary Institute (LPI), both in Houston, used a novel method for analyzing the dusty debris that covers the Moonโs surface called regolith . They learned that even under generous assumptions, meteorite delivery since about four billion years ago could only have supplied a small fraction of Earthโs water. The Moon serves as an ancient archive of the impact history โฆ

items.title: NASAโs Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings
items.summary: Like a recording artist who has had a long career, NASAโs Chandra X-ray Observatory has a โback catalogโ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the Chandra Source Catalog (CSC). The CSC containโฆ
items.body: 5 Min Read NASA’s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings Like a recording artist who has had a long career,  NASAโs Chandra X-ray Observatory  has a โback catalogโ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the  Chandra Source Catalog  (CSC). The CSC contains the  X-ray  data detected up to the end of 2020 by Chandra, the worldโs premier X-ray telescope and one of NASAโs โGreat Observatories.โ The latest version of the CSC, known as CSC 2.1, contains over 400,000 unique compact and extended sources and over 1.3 million individual detections in X-ray light. before after This image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blue respectively. NASA/CXC/SAO; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/N. Wolk This image is the sum of 86 observations added together, representing over three million seconds of Chandra observing time. It spans just about 60 light-years across, which is a veritable pinprick on the entire sky. The underlying image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blueโฆ

Full Hyperwall Agenda below. MONDAY, JANUARY 26 6:05 โ 6:20 PM Expanding Discovery from Earth Science Missions in Space Highlights of NASA Earth Science Missions to Advance Research, Data, Models, and Actionable Science Karen St. Germain 6:20 โ 6:35 PM Revolutionizing Exploration of the Sun Kelly Korreck 6:40 โ 6:55 PM Space Weather for Astronauts Jamie Favors Gina DiBraccio 6:55 โ 7:10 PM See Global Precipitation Without Writing Code George Huffman TUESDAY, JANUARY 2 7 10:00 โ 10:15 AM Removing Barriers to Utilizing NASA Research Data Paul Stackhouse 10:15 โ 10:30 AM Earth Data to Action โ Whatโs New with Earth Data? Jim OโSullivan 10:30 โ 10:45 AM Connecting Satellite Data to the One Health Approach Helena Chapman 3:00 โ 3:15 PM New Solar Observations and Solar Wind Measurements from the SOLAR-1 mission Dimitris Vassiliadis 3:15 โ 3:30 PM Aerosols Around the World Robert Levy 3:30 โ 3:45 PM NASAโs Mission to the Sun Eric Christian 3:45 โ 4:00 PM Expanding Discovery from Earth Scienโฆ

items.title: Journey to Center of Milky Way With Upcoming NASA Roman Core Survey
items.summary: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAโs Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of aโฆ
items.body: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAโs Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of astronomers from across the globe, the Roman Space Telescope will spend three-quarters of its five-year primary mission conducting three revolutionary surveys of unprecedented scale. Their combined results will transform all areas of astronomy and answer longstanding questions about dark matter, dark energy, and planets outside of our solar system, called exoplanets. That last theme will be addressed by the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey, which will peer into the center of our galaxy to study the stars and exoplanets that make up the densely populated region around the center of the Milky Way, known as the galactic bulge. This infographic describes the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey that will be conducted by NASAโs Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope. The smallest of Romanโs core surveys, this observation program will consist of repeat visits to six fields covering 1.7 square degrees โฆ
